articles.title: Extinct Ground Sloth – Mylodon darwinii – Likely Ate Meat With Its Veggies - SciTechDaily
articles.description: New study reveals that Mylodon was an omnivore, unlike its strictly plant-eating relatives. A new study led by researchers at the American Museum of Natural History suggests that Mylodon—a ground sloth that lived in South America until about 10,000 to 12,000 …
articles.content:
ByAmerican Museum of Natural HistoryOctober 7, 2021
Reconstruction of the South American giant ground sloth Mylodon darwinii feeding on the carcass of the hoofed native herbivore Macrauchenia. These… [+6428 chars]
